column4: i'm afraid i did that a few too many times myself.  Way I fixed it was to boot into cli and manually restore a backed up xorg.conf that works
Thanks for the tip, unfortunately I don't have a backup of my xorg.con (probably should have done that).
really?  I didn't personally make a backup either.  I just went into /etc/X11/ and found a few made.
Ok, I am in the recovery mode now (as root), I am going to browse to that directory and see what I can see..
